text: Divine Grace and Human Agency: A Study of the Semi-Pelagian Controversy (1996) is a book about the semi-Pelagian controversy published by Mercer University Press.__NOTOC__ ==Author== Rebecca Harden Weaver (born 1944) is Professor Emerita of Church History at Union Presbyterian Seminary. ==Reception== The book got mainly favorable reviews.Bonner, Gerald. "Divine Grace and Human Agency: A Study of the Semi-Pelagian Controversy." The Journal of Theological Studies, vol. 48, no. 1, 1997, p. 278+. Gale Academic OneFile, Accessed 1 May 2020. ==References== Category:1996 non-fiction books Category:Mercer University Press books Category:Pelagianism Category:Christian theology books Category:Books about ancient Christianity
title: Divine Grace and Human Agency
